cab.content: Copy No.WAR CABINET 116 (42).CONCLUSIONS of a Meeting of the War Cabinet held at 10 Downing Street,S.W. 1, on Saturday, August 22, 1942, at 12-30 p.m.Present :The Right Hon. C. R. Attlee, M.P., Deputy Prime Minister (in the Chair).The Right Hon. Sir Stafford Cripps,K.C., M.P., Lord Privy Seal.The Right Hon.M.P., LordCouncil.Sir John Anderson,President of theThe following were also present:The Right Hon. S. M. Bruce,Accredited Representative of theGovernment of the Commonwealthof Australia.Admiral of the Fleet Sir dudley pound, First Sea Lord and Chief ofNaval Staff.Air Chief Marshal Sir Charles F, A.Portal, Chief of the Air Staff.Lieutenant-General A. E. Nye, Vice-Chief of the Imperial General Staff.Secretariat:Major-General Sir Hastings Ismay.Mr. Norman Brook.Brigadier L. C. Hollis.Middle East The War Cabinet held a further discussion in regard to military certain high military appointments in the Middle East.Appointments. The.discussion and the conclusions reached are recorded in the(Previous . Secretary's Standard File of War Cabinet Conclusions.Reference:W.M. (42) 108thConclusions). Great George Street, S.W.1,A ugust 22, 1942.Printed for the War Cabinet. August 1942.SECRET.TBT.M. (42)116th Conclusions.TO BE KEPT UNDER LOCK AND KEY.It is requested that special care may be taken toensure the secrecy of this document.
